meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I blew out the candles on my birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: He blew a bubble with his gum.
meanings.sent3: The wind blew so hard that it blew away my hat!
meanings.sent4: Her amazing voice blew the audience away.
meanings.sent5: The strong gust of wind blew the leaves off the trees.

meanings.definition: To expel air forcefully through the mouth.
meanings.sent1: She blew on her hot soup to cool it down.
meanings.sent2: The child blew bubbles in the park.
meanings.sent3: The little girl blew a kiss to her mom before leaving.
meanings.sent4: The whistle blew loudly at the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The wind blew the clouds across the sky.

meanings.definition: To cause something to move or make a sound by expelling air.
meanings.sent1: The referee blew the whistle to start the game.
meanings.sent2: She blew the dust off the book before reading it.
meanings.sent3: The balloon blew up quickly and popped!
meanings.sent4: The wind blew the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: He blew the dust off the old photograph.

meanings.sent1: He blew all his savings on a new video game.
meanings.sent2: She blew her entire paycheck on clothes.
meanings.sent3: I blew my allowance on candy and toys.
meanings.sent4: They blew their budget on a fancy dinner.
meanings.sent5: The lottery winner blew through their winnings in a month.

meanings.definition: To be destroyed or ruined by an explosion.
meanings.sent1: The building blew up in a massive explosion.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks blew up in a spectacular display.
meanings.sent3: The science experiment blew up in their faces!
meanings.sent4: The bomb blew up the entire street.
meanings.sent5: The gas leak caused the house to blow up.
